name: Logically
description: Logically's AI-powered news app lets you see the news with fresh eyes. Get diverse perspectives on the stories you love, fact check suspicious articles to stop 'fake news', and see how events unfold over time. Don’t just read the news. Analyse, scrutinise and immerse yourself in it using Logically’s advanced AI tools.

jobs.title: PR & Communications Manager
jobs.description:
PR & Communications Manager

We are looking for a strong PR & Communications Manager to work within our Marketing Team. The right candidate will be able to hit the ground running in a fast-paced environment. They must have great written communication skills, strong media relations, a good knowledge of UK and US media, an understanding of what makes a good news hook and the ability to work with a certain level of autonomy.

We need a real news hound with a proven track record of getting results; must be happy to jump on the phones to drive coverage.

Key Responsibilities
 
- Pitching Logically updates and achievements to the media with tenacity.
- Drafting creative and engaging copy for press releases, media alerts, event invites and social media
- Actively doing trend searches to keep an eye on emerging trends that we can utilise and drafting reactive press materials off the back of them
- Researching important background information for media materials and campaign planning, whether specific industry trends, key calendar hooks, influencers / celebrities to partner with and/or venue suggestions for events.
- Helping to update the core media list with relevant contacts
- Taking ownership of the coverage tracker, ensuring all coverage is clipped and tracked so that we can report our great results effectively; coverage searches every morning
- Drafting accurate notes (minutes) during meetings
- Helping to compile coverage reports as required
- Attendance of relevant events to establish key contacts in the industry

Key attributes

- An established Publicist or Account Manager from an agency background
- A contact list of press contacts, influencers and celebrities
- Strong communication skills, both written and oral
- The ability to work well under pressure to meet deadlines and prioritise in a fast-paced environment.
- Excellent attention to detail, presenting a high quality of work to line management
- A positive, can-do attitude in response to challenging situations
- Must be efficient in Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint
- Strong research skills
 
Desirable

- Prior experience using Cision
- Bid writing experience
- A strong understanding of UK, US and Indian politics
- Have worked in the misinformation industry before
 
Please apply with the latest copy of your CV and best contact number and we will be touch as soon as possible to provide further details.


If you think that you're a great fit for the role then please get in touch at recruitment@logically.co.uk.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: COO
jobs.description:
Chief Operating Officer (COO) – Logically

About us

At Logically we are on a mission to improve the way we consume and interact with the news. In recent years we have witnessed a breakdown in civic discourse, and polarisation of our media and our politics. The effect of misinformation –the spread of which has only been exacerbated by social media –has furthered the decline in effective and constructive discourse in society.

We believe that, although complex and far-reaching, these problems are not insurmountable. Using advanced AI technologies Logically builds tools that aim to improve the quality of the journalism we read and platforms that contextualise the heaps of information available to us so that we are better informed about the topics that matter to us.

In light of the recent spread of fake news and echo chambers across digital platforms, Logically is being built to improve the way you learn about the things that are important to you and your community. Logically will make sure that you can quickly consume credible information, balanced with factual counterpoints and is logically coherent.

The role

As Chief Operating Officer (COO) at Logically you will play a key role in supporting our growth to oversee ongoing operations.  You will work alongside the CEO to help build key processes in the company as it scales rapidly over the next year.

The role is the perfect opportunity for somebody who is passionate about improving the value and build sustainable operations whilst supporting exponential growth.  Logically has grown quickly in the past couple of years, so you'll play an important part of setting the foundations to scale up the business.  

What value you will add

•	Overseeing the daily delivery of the company operations by managing and supporting the design of scalable processes and systems, as well as supporting their teams' growth.
•	Managing Logically’s senior leadership team and assisting them on developing their individual teams
•	Setting objectives that are aligned with the business goals and define KPIs to monitor performance
•	Introducing and building out key processes and procedures for the Logically team
•	Overseeing operations of the whole company, with teams based in London, Brighouse & India
•	Managing onboarding of new staff, employment contracts and performance management
•	Assisting with commercial and legal contracts and approvals, licenses, insurance & accounting management
•	Making sure systems are in place for payment of invoices and ensuring payments are paid on time, as well taking ownership of accounts payable
•	Helping to shape and maintain the company culture and maintain that as Logically scales
•	Overall responsibility for Office and facility management
•	Representing the Operations team at a local and global level so growth pain points are addressed quickly 
•	Partnering with our global operations and tech teams to review our strategy and build our operations to manage 2x, 10x our volumes


What we are looking for

•	Experience in hiring and team coordination.
•	Experience in assisting a startup to scale from seed to Series B+, and built out mechanisms to handle this
•	Someone who is comfortable negotiating and coordinating legal contracts 
•	Experience managing cross-functional operations teams
•	Experience working with different levels of management and individual contributors, as well as frontline teams 
•	Experience working with Tech/Product or building scalable systems/platforms 
•	Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
•	Strong business judgement and critical thinking skills 
•	Excellent analytical skills, with advanced knowledge of Excel 

This is a key role in Logically's exciting growth. If you want to learn more, please reach out to recruitment@logically.co.uk
